div.p: From Frederick Bailey to John Anderson
Letter press copy book 2, pp. 114-15, Queensland Herbarium, Brisbane.

I have the honor to acknowledge receipt of your letter the 1st inst: requesting the suggestion of some work to take the place of Baron Mueller's Botanic Teachings.
B77.08.01. J. G. Anderson was Under Secretary for Education in Qld.
IF kept, Anderson will need an entry on Biog Reg, see ADB
This work was not suitable and indeed never was intended for the use of Queensland schools. The same may be said of Mr Guilfoyles works all these are useful probably in the colonies for which they were intended but do not meet our requirements. A work of the kind issued last year in N Zealand seems to my mind the style of work we require. The book I refer to is "Introductory class-book of Botany for use in New Zealand Schools by Geo. M Thomson F.L.S. Science master in the Dunedin High School. The style of this work pleases me and if required I would prepare one on the same plan. In fact all required to make this work suitable for Queensland would be the use of our plants in examples with perhaps an additional one or so to meet our more extensive flora.
